syllabus_info.syllabus_name: Cambridge International AS & A Level Physics 9702

learning_objectives.description: understand and use the terms period, frequency and peak value as applied to an alternating current or voltage
use equations of the form x = x₀ sin ωt representing a sinusoidally alternating current or voltage
recall and use the fact that the mean power in a resistive load is half the maximum power for a sinusoidal alternating current
distinguish between root-mean-square (r.m.s.) and peak values and recall and use Ir.m.s. = I₀/√2 and Vr.m.s. = V₀/√2 for a sinusoidal alternating current
